00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implement vector dot product.
00004 #
00005 package Parser::BOP::dot;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::BOP);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  Check that the operands are vectors of compatible types.
00011 #
00012 sub _check {
00013   my $self = shift;
00014   return if $self->checkStrings();
00015   return if $self->checkLists();
00016   return if $self->checkNumbers();
00017   my ($ltype,$rtype) = $self->promotePoints();
00018   if ($ltype->{name} eq 'Vector' && $rtype->{name} eq 'Vector') {
00019     if (Parser::Item::typeMatch($ltype,$rtype) || $self->context->flag("allowBadOperands"))
00020       {$self->{type} = $Value::Type{number}} else {$self->matchError($ltype,$rtype)}
00021   }
00022   elsif ($self->context->flag("allowBadOperands")) {$self->{type} = $Value::Type{number}}
00023   else {$self->Error("Operands for dot product must be Vectors")}
00024 }
00025 
00026 #
00027 #  Use perl '.' for dot product
00028 #   (see Value.pm; special care must be taken to make string concatenation
00029 #    work with this.)
00030 #
00031 sub _eval {$_[1] . $_[2]}
00032 
00033 #
00034 #  Return zero if one operand is zero.
00035 #  Factor out negatives.
00036 #
00037 sub _reduce {
00038   my $self = shift;
00039   my $reduce = $self->{equation}{context}{reduction};
00040   return $self->Item("Number")->new($self->{equation},0)
00041     if ($self->{lop}{isZero} && $reduce->{'0.x'}) || ($self->{rop}{isZero} && $reduce->{'x.0'});
00042   return $self->makeNeg($self->{lop}{op},$self->{rop}) if $self->{lop}->isNeg && $reduce->{'(-x).y'};
00043   return $self->makeNeg($self->{lop},$self->{rop}{op}) if $self->{rop}->isNeg && $reduce->{'x.(-y)'};
00044   return $self;
00045 }
00046 
00047 $Parser::reduce->{'x.0'} = 1;
00048 $Parser::reduce->{'0.x'} = 1;
00049 $Parser::reduce->{'(-x).y'} = 1;
00050 $Parser::reduce->{'x.(-y)'} = 1;
00051 
00052 #########################################################################
00053 
00054 1;
